page.title: 11Lupton House
page.content: Lupton House stands in the centre of the square; this was the home of Lord and Lady Churston. It is now a school for disturbed children. The afforestation in this area is quite extensive with 31% deciduous trees of the beech and sycamore variety plus a small selection of nearly every tree found in the British Isles. There is 61% rough grazing and 8% housing. The buses from Brixham and Kingswear also go through this area. Extensive housing and house building is going on in the Summercombe area, these are mainly occupied by commuters to the local towns.
